source.fileName: TTM5063 Wensum Flemish Bruges Antwerp Ghent  lo.pdf

elements.text: The Arts Society Wensum presents
Flemish Masters –
Bruges, Antwerp & Ghent
5 days from £1,199 Departing 30th September 2026
FEATURES
• 4* central Bruges hotel
• Welcome dinner included
• All excursions, entrance fees &
guided tours included
• Canal cruise on Day 2 included
• Tour manager throughout
• Eurotunnel crossings
• Executive coach throughout
• Porterage & local accommodation
tax included
• Audio headsets included on
Days 2 to 4
WHAT WE WILL SEE
• Bruges – guided walking tour
• Bruges Canal Cruise
• Groeninge Museum
• Antwerp – guided walking tour
• Rubens House – guided tour
• Ghent – guided walking tour
• St Bavo Cathedral &
‘The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb’
• Ghent Museum of Fine Arts –
guided tour
• Palais des Beaux Arts at Lille –
guided tour
ACCOMMODATION
We stay four nights at the centrally
located 4* Dukes’ Academie Hotel
(https://www.dukesacademie.com/) in
Bruges. Located under a fifteen minute
walk from the market square, facilities at
the hotel include a breakfast room and
bar. All rooms are en suite and feature
television, tea & coffee making facilities,
and an in room safe. A set three course
dinner without drinks is included at the
Maximiliaan van Oostenrijk Restaurant
(located a 100 metres walk from the
hotel) on the first evening. The remaining
three nights are on a bed and breakfast
basis.
EXTRAS TO YOUR TOUR
• Single room supplement £199
• Insurance (including Covid cover) £92
• Gratuities
• Dinners on Days 2, 3 & 4
• Lunches
s e • Donations at any churches or
g cathedrals visited
u r
B Price based on twin share. Minimum numbers
required. Normal booking conditions apply.
For more information on this tour contact your Group Organiser
Susanna Smart
Email: susannasmart@outlook.com Tailored Travel’s ATOL
80 Thorpe Road, Norwich NR1 1BA
Great Market Square, Antwerp
Vie w a nd sha r e this to u r o nlin e - click o n Vie w Yo u r To u r at w w w.tailo r ed-tr a v el. c o . uk a nd qu ote w e nd261
The Arts Society Wensum presents
Flemish Masters –
Bruges, Antwerp & Ghent
5 days from £1,199 Departing 30th September 2026
WHAT WE WILL SEE
Day 1
We depart by executive coach from our designated pick up point and
Guided walking tour
travel with our tour manager to Folkestone for our Eurotunnel crossing to
of Bruges Calais. On arrival in Bruges we check into the 4* Dukes’ Academie Hotel
for a four night stay. A welcome dinner is included at a restaurant close to
Bruges Canal Cruise
our hotel this evening.
Groeninge Museum Day 2
This morning, we enjoy an included guided walking tour of Bruges, whose
Guided walking tour historic city centre is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Known as the
of Antwerp ‘Venice of the North’, Bruges is famous for lace making, chocolate and its
picturesque network of canals. An included 45 minute cruise on the
Rubens House
picturesque canals of Bruges enables us to see the city from a different
perspective. This afternoon we visit the Groeninge Museum in Bruges,
Guided walking tour
home to a fine collection of Flemish and Belgian painting from Jan Van
of Ghent
Eyck to Marcel Broodthears, a wide range of Renaissance and Baroque
St Bavo Cathedral & ‘The Masters and representations of Belgian Symbolism and Modernism.
Adoration of the Mystic Day 3
Lamb’ Our morning guided tour of Antwerp takes in sights such as the Great
Market Square, Town Hall, Butchers’ Guild House and the Cathedral of
Ghent Museum of Fine Arts Our Lady. This afternoon we visit Rubens House, the former house of
Peter Rubens from 1616 until his death in 1640. The house was built
Palais des Beaux Arts at Lille around an inner courtyard and the Baroque portico between the
courtyard and the Flemish-Italian Renaissance garden was designed by
the master himself. Our guided tour of the House introduces us to the life
and works of Rubens, including his self portrait, ‘Adam and Eve in
Paradise’, ‘Henry IV in the battle for Paris’ and a portrait of Sir Anthony
Van Dyck as a boy.
Day 4
We visit Ghent this morning for a guided walking tour. Originally the
St Bavo Cathedral, capital of Flanders, Ghent retains more historical buildings than any other
‘The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb’
Flemish city. Here we visit St Bavo Cathedral, which is home to the
famous 24-panel altarpiece ‘The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb’. This
afternoon we have a guided tour at the Ghent Museum of Fine Arts with
works ranging from 19th century Realism, Romanticism, Impressionism,
Symbolism and Expressionism to 20th century Surrealism, including two
works by Hieronymus Bosch.
Day 5
After checking out of our hotel we enjoy a guided tour at the Palais des
Ghent Beaux Arts at Lille, considered by many to be one of France’s most
important galleries. Taking carefully selected comfort stops en route, we
return to Calais for our return Eurotunnel crossing to Folkestone, and
onwards coach travel back to our original pick up point.
NB:- Due to regulations in Bruges, coaches have restricted access within the city centre.
On the first and last days of the tour, the coach will drop us off at a designated point
which is less than a three minute walk away from the hotel. Porterage between the
coach and hotel is included in the cost of the tour (one piece of luggage per person).
Please note we reserve the right to alter the above itinerary if required for operational
reasons. Given the historic nature of the places visited, a certain degree of walking will
be involved, and this holiday may not be suitable for those with mobility problems.
Lille Fine Arts Museum
